name: lotlsecurity
description:
The article describes in human-friendly detail some of the most common insecure practices and vulnerabilities in modern software development.
The one you always remember first is 'sanitise your inputs'. Anywhere you don't have control of data coming in, make sure it can't do anything malicious.
There's a more detailed (if somewhat dry) reference online.

reward.message: Congratulations. You've learned a basic mnemonic for considering software security.
